background: The landscaper needs to decide how to allocate square footage of grass cutting between a heavy-duty yard machine and a gas lawn mower, considering pollution and fuel constraints.
constraints: Square feet cut by heavy-duty yard machine is non-negative
Square feet cut by gas lawn mower is non-negative
Total square feet cut is equal to A
Total pollution produced by heavy-duty yard machine and gas lawn mower is at most PollutionMax
Total fuel used by heavy-duty yard machine and gas lawn mower is at most FuelTotal
objective: Minimize the total time required to cut A square feet of grass
description: A landscaper has \param{A} square feet of grass land in a customer’s backyard where they need to cut grass using either a heavy-duty yard machine or a gas lawn mower. For each square foot of land, the heavy-duty yard machine requires \param{TimeHeavyDuty} seconds while the gas lawn mower takes \param{TimeGasMower} seconds. Per square foot, the heavy-duty yard machine produces \param{PollutionHeavyDuty} units of pollution and requires \param{FuelHeavyDuty} units of fuel. Conversely, the gas lawn mower generates \param{PollutionGasMower} units of pollution for each square foot and requires \param{FuelGasMower} units of fuel. There are \param{FuelTotal} units of fuel available and the landscaper can produce no more than \param{PollutionMax} units of pollution. For how many square feet should each machine be used to minimize the time required to cut this customer’s backyard?
